intro: Styloglossum leucosceptrum var. bisubuliferum, commonly known as the white-headed vellvetleaf, is a variant of the Styloglossum leucosceptrum species. It is a perennial herbaceous plant characterized by its soft, velvety leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shady environments, often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and somewhat rare species within the Asteraceae family.
